Deficiency Narrative: During the Investigaton it was discovered that a staff member was unfamiliar with the agency's operational policies.
Correction Narrative:
RCCR Inspector made phone contact with the administrator to request for compliance documents, and he stated that the staff were retrained on how to handle fights/confrontations on 9/3/25 and he thought that he had already sent me the compliance documents via email, but I informed him that he had not. Compliance documents were sent to me after the phone call, and the documents were reviewed. 

On 9/3/25, the staff members were retrained on client safety protocols which included: 
1.  Having a supervisor scheduled in each 2nd shift during the duration of the safety plan. 
2. Staff members will insert themselves between residents who are engaged in a verbal escalation before it becomes physical.
3. If a physical confrontation is about to occur, staff members will utilize EBI techniques, separate the residents and move other residents out of the area. 
4. Staff will intervene when physical altercations occur and immediately separate the residents using MAB and UKERU. 
5. Staff members will reach out to other staff members using walkie talkies or other means to prevent escalations. 

17 signatures of staff members were also provided. The document can be found in the document library.

Deficiency Narrative: A youth care specialist admitted to using profanity towards a child in care.
Correction Narrative: RCCR Inspector conducted an unannounced follow up visit on 5/15/2024 and the inspection number was 4001903. Two children were interviewed about the staff using profanity and there were no concerns. The compliance was also met by the operation whereby they held an interdisciplinary treatment team meeting and ensured that staff had read the communication binder regarding profanity and a copy of the signatures of the employees was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, on Unit B, in one of the bedrooms, the trim in the corner by the bed was detached from the wall and appeared that it could fall.
Correction Narrative: The strip of Formica has been repaired as instructed and a picture of the correction can be found in the document library. The administrator the provided the pictures of the fixed trim.

Deficiency Narrative: Due to the child's history, the safety plan did not implement a plan to ensure the proper protocol to keep a child safe that has a history of self-harm.
Correction Narrative: Admission procedures were reviewed, and we will continue to identify high risk behaviors in our intake assessment, and we will continue to develop a safety plan for every new resident in our program. We will continue to update resident safety plans to ensure staff are kept up to date on all high-risk behaviors and our current interventions to negate as much of the risk as possible

Deficiency Narrative: A child was able to obtain a pair of scissors and use to cut their own hair.
Correction Narrative: The decision has been made and implemented to remove all scissors from the RTC building other than one pair to be kept in the knife cabinet pictured above.  We have also reorganized the knife cabinet to better account for all our sharps including disposing of all our current cutlery and ordering new cutlery that can be hung in the cabinet for easy auditing.  The scissors are labeled and included in the cabinet.  This cabinet is locked and is also located in a locked pantry, inaccessible to the children residing in our program.

Deficiency Narrative: Child files reviewed, two out of two files were missing the child's religion or religious preference.
Correction Narrative: Religious preferences were added to the two files missing them and will now be documented on all intakes going forward.

Deficiency Narrative: 7 child medication logs were reviewed. Of the 7 logs reviewed, 5 child files documented a medical professional who was not the actual physical listed on the medication label.
An employee at your operation showed favoritism to one particular child as well as buying inappropriate gifts for this child.
Correction Narrative: Operation indicated that employee is no longer on shift at RTC location and has no contact with any children at the RTC. Employee will meet with the Residential Director regarding his status as an employee and will be required to complete a personal boundary training with the Residential Director before being again given access to the RTC Program or its residents.  This meeting and training will occur prior to any prolonged access to the RTC Program or residents.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 of the 2 employment files reviewed did not have "none" written on the notarized affidavit concerning incidents involving children as required.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided required updated notarized affidavit

Deficiency Narrative: The LCCA is the administrator for two operations however a written staffing plan was not completed.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided written plan on 10/12/22. Verified during inspection at operation.

Deficiency Narrative: The medication logs for four children do not document the medication error including the time and dates the children were without medications.
Correction Narrative: An inspection was completed at the operation on 11/08/2022 Medication logs were reviewed for both male and female residents and found to be in compliance. Operation treatment director does daily checks of medication log to ensure accuracy

Deficiency Narrative: Management staff did not instruct direct care staff on what was the supervision requirements for a child with known self-harming behaviors.
Correction Narrative:
Operation Response:
The new lanyard system, the supervision requirements will be printed each residents safety plan and this safety plan along with the childs name will be worn on a lanyard by the staff responsible and will be passed to the next staff responsible be it during a shift change or simply a staff member taking a break and passing supervision responsibilities to another staff member.  Included on the safety plan will be supervision requirements and special instructions for issues such as self harm behaviors or elopement risk, etc.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff responsible for the supervision of a child in care did not  provide the level of supervision indicated on the preliminary service plan.
Correction Narrative:
Operation Response:
We have implemented a Lanyard System that included all staff wearing a lanyard which has the child they are responsible for along with a copy of their safety plan on the lanyard for easy reference. As staff pass a child to another staff member for supervision, the lanyard then is passed to that staff as well.  This ensures every child is always supervised and the staff member responsible for the resident knows who they are responsible for at any given moment.  Most importantly, any service plan information that is in need of a safety plan will be transferred to the lanyard and the staff member responsible for the supervision of the resident will know that information as it will be printed on the lanyard.  In response to the TA given, we will also be documenting/auditing verification that each staff member is following each childs supervision plan in part by assigning staff to children and their associated lanyards at the beginning of each shift and documenting the headcount at the end of each shift ensuring all children are accounted for each shift.  Supervisors will be meeting with each staff member during shift change ensuring they know the supervision plan and that it will be followed throughout the shift.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care service plan indicated that she not to be left alone no more than 15 minutes at a time. The caregiver responsible for supervising a child, left the child alone for over 40 minutes unattended, thinking other caregivers were supervising her.
Correction Narrative:
Operation Response:
Our new lanyard system ensures that every staff member knows exactly which child they are responsible for as they will be literally wearing the name of the children they are supervising around their necks.  As the staff switch up supervision responsibilities, so will the lanyard travel.  For example, a staff member has John Does lanyard around their neck along with three other children they are supervising during school hours.  John Doe has an appointment at the dentist so the staff member transporting John Doe will not only take John Doe but also will wear his lanyard during the appointment, ensuring the lanyard passes along with the resident from staff member to staff member.  The Safety Plan on each lanyard will also include how often checks will need to be done when a resident is in their bathroom, in their room or in the sensory room, etc throughout the day.  Our standard supervision includes 15 minute checks during sleeping hours and 10 minute checks during awake hours.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member did not use appropriate de-escalation techniques with a youth in care.  The caregiver taunted the child by swinging a mop in the childs direction as well as mopping a beanbag used by the youth.
Correction Narrative: Inspector T. Amie staffed case with Supervisor regarding deficiency. A background check was ran on employee for whom deficiency was issued and it shows that as of 06/29/22 that the employee is inactive and no longer affiliated with operation and presents no risk to children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 child left the operation on 07/18 and returned on 07/18. The serious incident report does not document a debriefing with the child.
Correction Narrative:
Compliance Plan: 
Operation informed that Refresher training on how to properly complete an Incident Report, including how to complete a debriefing with youth upon their return from a runaway incident, will be conducted by the Director of Residential Services-Wichita Campus and/or Clinical Manager  and will be initiated no later than 10/1/21. In addition, prior to approving submitted incident reports, the Director of Residential Services-Wichita Campus and/or RTC Program Manager will require the debriefing section be complete prior to approval and will follow-up with the staff submitting the report to ensure this information is added as appropriate.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care ran away from the operation on 07/18 and returned on 7/19 and the report was received on 7/23.
Caretakers at the operation did not provide proper supervision to a child in care allowing for the child to cause a self injury to themselves requiring hospitalization
Correction Narrative: Operation provides specific supervision protocols for residents as needed. The subject of this investigation has been discharged and is no longer at the facility.

Police responded to a call made by the operation to assist with child behaviors on 02/08. The police response/arrests were not reported to Licensing until 02/17.
A staff member restrained a child to prevent the child from running away.
Correction Narrative: New EBI Policy has been adopted by the operation which is on file on Sharedrive. This policy was adopted in response to other EBI issues the operation had, and has been put into place during the time this investigation was on A/R status

Deficiency Narrative: It was discovered during this investigation that staff did not follow supervision guidelines outlined on the children the operation had in care service plan
Correction Narrative:
Operation sent the following Compliance Plan to address this deficiency: Our residents Plans of Service are now being kept in the Staff Communication Log in the Staff office and include a signature page (attachment A) indicating all staff have read the Plans of Service.  

Further, all associated safety plans (developed in large part directly from the Plans of Service) are now being posted in plain sight for staffs eyes only as well as being kept in the Staff Communication Log along with signature pages to indicate all staff members have read all safety plans. 

In addition, precautions continue to be posted for all staff and residents to follow assuring yet another layer of notification of any important requirements of supervision also derived in part from the Plans of Service

Deficiency Narrative: A 16 year old child was inappropriately restrained, resulting in the child receiving a bruise to the cheek and arm, when the caregiver slammed the child to the ground.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted to the operation. During that inspection a review of files, updated policies and procedures as it relates to EBI, and interviews was conducted. The agency was found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver slams a child in care to the ground causing that child to loose consciousness. The caregiver then continued restraining the child in a prone position for approximately 30 seconds, while the child lay unmoving.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted to the operation. During that inspection a review of files, updated policies and procedures as it relates to EBI, and interviews was conducted. The agency was found to be in compliance.The staff member is no longer employed. The operation hired and transferred in team supervisors with more experience in delivering trauma informed care in residential programs. The operation has researched and are implementing additional training including Ukeru systems for crisis management,  a six-week training course for direct care staff on de-escalation and emotion coaching skills for staff to increase trauma informed care responses and reduce secondary trauma impacting our staff while working with some of the highest acuity clients in our system. Full policy is on file.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver used excessive force during a restraint. The restraint caused the child to loose consciousness, sustain bruising, and feel pain.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted to the operation. During that inspection a review of files, updated policies and procedures as it relates to EBI, and interviews was conducted. The agency was found to be in compliance. The staff member is no longer employed. The operation hired and transferred in team supervisors with more experience in delivering trauma informed care in residential programs. The operation has researched and are implementing additional training including Ukeru systems for crisis management,  a six-week training course for direct care staff on de-escalation and emotion coaching skills for staff to increase trauma informed care responses and reduce secondary trauma impacting our staff while working with some of the highest acuity clients in our system. Full policy is on file.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 of the 4 employment files reviewed did not have a notarized signature for the employment affidavit.

Deficiency Narrative: On 10/07/2020 a safety plan was signed agreeing that a team supervisor would be needed on shift to ensure a child's safety from a direct staff. On 10/22/20 a monitoring inspection was conducted at night. There was no supervisor on site as well as the direct staff, with restricted duties, was considered the lead for the night.

Deficiency Narrative: Several medication logs indicated that children were not provided medications as prescribed: 10/04-Polythlene Glycol, 10/14 Abilify, 10/09 and 10/22 Quetipine Fumarate, 10/01-10/14 Clondine, Quetiapine, Bupropion, Certizine, Missed 10 days of Denta 5000, and 9 days of Chlornexidine
Correction Narrative: The operation emailed safety plan was submitted today stating that Medication Audits will be conducted weekly for the next 90 days. All staff will be retrained by the nurse within the next 30 days.

Correction Narrative: Operation provided new forms along with guidelines that all staff must adhere to going forward concerning any injury/illness along with a test that all staff must now take to test their knowledge of correct injury protocol, this include current staff. Compliance is acceptable and meets criteria for on-going compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member restrained a child for attempting to pick up an earring.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted detailed compliance plan outlining new policies and procedures to ensure that compliance for this deficiency was met as well as on-going compliance to reduce risk for any future incidents.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member pulled a child's arm which caused the child to fall to the ground. This action increased risk which eventually escalated the child's behavior to self harm.
Correction Narrative: The Administrator implemented a safety plan suspending the staff member who caused a child in care harm. The staff member then resigned. The staff member is now marked inactive and no longer has access to the facility.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care's needs instructed for behavioral management techniques which considered a history of PHAB and PTSD. This child was not provided time to self regulate or de-escalate.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted detailed compliance plan outlining new policies and procedures to ensure that compliance for this deficiency was met as well as on-going compliance to reduce risk for any future incidents.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver initiated a physical altercation with a child in care which included inappropriately grabbing and restraining the child. This action escalated the child's behaviors and resulted in an injury. Observing staff members did not intervene.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted detailed compliance plan outlining new policies and procedures to ensure that compliance for this deficiency was met as well as on-going compliance to reduce risk for any future incidents.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation staff restrained a child in a supine position for more than one minute.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted compliance addressing deficiency. Operation plan indicated that of the individuals involved in the actual incident, one is no longer employed at the operation and the other has been retrained and all of the staff will be retrained this month on proper techniques to further reduce risk
